intro: Epilobium mutabile, commonly known as variable willow herb, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic, and often have a waxy coating. Epilobium mutabile is known for its variability in flower color and leaf shape, which contributes to its common name.
